summary: The LEO K9 Protection Act amends Title 18 of the United States Code to address the protection of law enforcement animals, specifically dogs and horses. It increases penalties for harming these animals. The bill also mandates the Secretary of Transportation to publish guidelines for emergency medical services personnel to care for injured police dogs and to establish regulations to facilitate their transportation for veterinary care and allow paramedics/EMTs to provide on-site care. Lastly, it defines a 'police dog' for the purposes of the act.
